post_message: In 1990, American explorer and marine biologist Sylvia Earle became the first woman chief scientist at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). For nearly six decades, she has led an international community of scientists in the study, protection, and restoration of our planet's marine life. Her unyielding curiosity and commitment to reversing the effects of climate change are a source of inspiration for environmentalists worldwide. Thank you, Sylvia.
